4.verification_summary: Using Ito calculus, if df = f'(x) dx + 1/2 f''(x) b(x)^2 dt, requiring f'(x) b(x) = beta and matching drift gives a(x) = (alpha/beta) b(x) + (1/2) b(x) b'(x); thus the claimed transform for constant drift and diffusion follows, though ergodicity of the resulting f depends on the domain and boundary conditions.

15.verification_summary: The claim outlines four commonly discussed theoretical limitations: reliance on infinity in asymptotic analysis despite finite pre-asymptotic life, neglecting preferences for early resolution of uncertainty, assuming agents know true dynamics and objective uncertainty, and the suggestion to extend frameworks to ambiguity aversion or robustness.
